prompt: A star located at a distance of 500 parsecs has an apparent magnitude of 6.2. Calculate its absolute magnitude using Astropy.
code: [EOL]from astropy import units as u[EOL]import numpy as np[EOL]from astropy.constants import L_sun[EOL][EOL]apparent_mag = 6.2[EOL]distance = 50 * u.pc[EOL]absolute_mag = apparent_mag - 5 * (np.log10(distance / u.pc) - 1)[EOL]answer = absolute_mag[EOL]

prompt: A galaxy is observed to have a redshift of 0.0003740665904198082. Calculate its recessional velocity using Astropy.
code: [EOL]from astropy.cosmology import Planck18 as cosmo[EOL]from astropy import units as u[EOL][EOL]redshift = 0.0003740665904198082[EOL]recessional_velocity = cosmo.H0 * redshift * cosmo.comoving_distance(redshift)[EOL]answer = recessional_velocity.to(u.km/u.s)[EOL]
